body_html:
I thought with deb packages, in the end we had symlinks for cudnn.h and library files that provide a structure as @prb12 described. It looks like that is not the case.
I think for the error message, what happened is user entered /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/ as cudnn root directory. Our source code assumes what @prb12 described, so /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/include/cudnn.h is probably constructed by our code.

We will need to update our configure script to avoid this assumption.

body:
I thought with deb packages, in the end we had symlinks for cudnn.h and library files that provide a structure as @prb12 described. It looks like that is not the case.
I think for the error message, what happened is user entered `/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/` as cudnn root directory. Our source code assumes what @prb12 described, so `/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/include/cudnn.h` is probably constructed by our code.

We will need to update our configure script to avoid this assumption.
